comment.author: 36587131@N06
comment._content:
This is Church of the Transfiguration in Spas-Nereditsy. Built in 1198.
Церковь Спаса на Нередице, Великий Новгород.

comment.author: 34419668@N08
comment._content: Lodo27: Thank you so much for identifying this beautiful church and giving us the correct location! We'll be able to correct our data on the photo thanks to you :) (I'm not quite sure about the spelling of the place though. Spas-Nereditsy - Nereditsky - Nereditsa... Would it all be correct?) I found some more information on the site "VisitNovgorod": www.visitnovgorod.com/catalogue/valday/4311/5265.html Seems it has been a monastery church. Interesting! Would be great to know if the bell tower is still left, if anyone can tell. /Anna B.

comment.author: 36587131@N06
comment._content: Church of the Transfiguration in Spas-Nereditsy Spas-Nereditsy - the name of the village (Спас-Нередицы) or Church of the Transfiguration at Nereditsa Hill Nereditsa - the name of the Hill (Нередица) World Heritage № 604-006. The Church of Our Saviour at Nereditsa. whc.unesco.org/en/list/604/multiple=1&unique_number=716 The bell tower of the church was broken during the Second World War (1941). Survived 40% of the walls. That you can see now - it is a reconstruction. Photos of the church: www.temples.ru/gallery.php?CardID=6231

comment.author: 34419668@N08
comment._content:
Lodo27: Thanks for this further information!
/Anna B.
